articles.description: Italian clubs will now be allowed to return to training from this Monday after the lifting of a country-wide ban on team sports brought forward by two weeks
articles.content:
Serie A clubs will now be allowed to return to training on Monday, two weeks ahead of schedule, as football continues its attempts to come back from coronavirus chaos. 
The Italian government had initially decreed that only athletes from individual sports wo… [+2005 chars]

articles.title: Arsenal begin Henrikh Mkhitaryan transfer talks as Gunners seek to raise funds - Mirror Online
articles.description: The Armenian has just one year left on his contract at the Emirates Stadium and Arsenal are keen to take advantage of Roma's interest, with the Italians keen to take the loanee on a permanent basis
articles.content:
Arsenal are ready to sell Henrikh Mkhitaryan this summer to help raise funds for a low budget transfer window.
Roma are keen to sign Mkhitaryan on a permanent basis after having him on loan this season and the 31-year-old midfielder has one year left on his … [+2079 chars]

articles.title: Betrayal and bombast: the surreal story of the Terry v Bridge saga - The Guardian
articles.description: More than a decade on, fact and fiction remain entangled in the tale of former teammates turned enemies. The human core of the entire episode, though, is not a footballer
